result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/07/22 by 10:00 AM

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

8:22 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Fox, Defendant Joshua Michael Roesler in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Joshua Michael Roesler.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CF125 and 22CT31.  ADA Damrau recites agreement. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads GUILTY to counts 1, 3, and 4 in 22CF125. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty to counts 1, 3, and 4 in 22CF125. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses count 2 in 22CF125 and READS IN and dismisses 22CT31. Court withholds adjudication in Count 1 in 22CF125 in favor of 2 year DJOC agreement. Bond to remain in case 22CF125. Sentence recommendations. Court Orders 
Count 3 in 22CF125 - S/W 2 years probation with conditions: 
- 6 months condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Balance to be pd through clerk of court. 
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Balance to be pd through clerk of court. 
- DNA Sample
- AODA within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested by DOC
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 
- Participate St. Croix County Restorative justice program
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.  
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent and pay supervision fees

Count 4: I/S - 2 years probation with conditions: 
- 3 months in St. Croix County jail -  STAYED
- Court Costs $243 payable through clerk of court
- DNA Surcharge $200 payable through clerk of court

- Sign up for probation by 10:00 am on 9/7/22
Advised of right to appeal. Adjourned: 8:50 am

8:49 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Joshua Michael Roesler. Defendant Joshua Michael Roesler appeared by video. Includes 22CF125 and 22CT31. Court reviews case. ADA Damrau states offer was provided to Atty Krave this morning. Atty Krave has not reviewed offer and requests additional time. Recess 08:51 AM to allow time for Atty Krave to review offer with DE. Back on Record 09:00 AM. Same appearances. Atty Krave states there is a resolution and request to set plea. Court sets PLEAS.  Court confirms address. Adjourned 09:03 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Joshua Michael Roesler. Defendant Joshua Michael Roesler appeared by video. Includes 22CF125 and 22CT31. Court reviews case. Atty Krave states DE did not accept the offer. ADA Rockow states new ADA will be taking over file and request to set for FPT to allow ADA to make final offer. Court sets STC. Court confirms address and phone number. Adjourned 04:07 PM
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

ADA Rockow states discovery has been sent. Atty Krave doesn't anticipate any motions. Court sets STC to allow time for resolution.
